info.title: Asset Repository API
info.description: REST endpoints for retrieving information about assets revisions.

servers.description: Replace ODC_PORTAL_DOMAIN with the domain of your organization.
Replace {odc-portal-domain} with the domain of your organization.

post.summary: Creates a new revision of an asset.
post.description:
Creates a new revision for an asset from a source code file (OML/XIF).

If the asset does not exist, it creates the asset and its first revision.

You can provide the source code as an application/octet-stream or as a multipart/form-data file.

To create an asset, API Client needs the **Asset management > Create** permission.

To create a new revision for an existing asset, API Client needs the **Asset management > Change** permission.
post.x-os-permissions:
To create an asset, API Client needs the **Asset management > Create** permission.

To create a new revision for an existing asset, API Client needs the **Asset management > Change** permission.

get.description: Returns a list of the latest revision for all assets that match the specified filters.

parameters.name: nameContains
parameters.description: Filters assets by name.

parameters.name: nameOrDescriptionContains
parameters.description: Filters assets by name or description.

parameters.name: assetTypes
parameters.description: Filter by one or more asset types, recognized values are [WebApplication, MobileApplication, LowCodeLibrary, ExtensionLibrary, ExternalConnection, ExternalLibrary, Workflow, WidgetLibrary, AIModelConnection, SearchServiceConnection, Agent, MCPConnection].

parameters.name: assetKeys
parameters.description: Filter by one or more asset keys.

parameters.name: embed
parameters.description: Embedded resources to return with the Asset Revision.

parameters.name: metadata.urlPathContains
parameters.description: Filters assets by url path.

parameters.name: metadata.templateType
parameters.description: Filter assets that are templates of a specific template type.

parameters.name: metadata.isDeployable
parameters.description: Filter assets that can be deployed to environments (e.g. exclude libraries and templates).

parameters.name: metadata.isBuiltInAsset
parameters.description: Filter asset based on if they are builtin type.

parameters.name: isExternal
parameters.description: Filter asset based on if it is external or not.

parameters.name: permissionFilter
parameters.description: Filter by a specific permission type.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Used for sorting the list. Ascending by default. Prepend a hyphen, "-", to get a descending sort. Allowed: name, createdAt.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the first result returned.

delete.description:
Deletes an asset. You cannot delete built-in assets.

API Client needs the **Asset management > Delete** permission.

parameters.name: assetKey
parameters.description: The asset's key.

delete.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **Asset management > Delete** permission.

get.summary: Gets the latest revision of a specific asset.
get.description: Returns the latest revision of a specific asset.

parameters.name: assetKey
parameters.description: The asset's key.

parameters.name: embed
parameters.description: Embedded resources to return with the Asset Revision.

get.summary: Gets the highest-tagged revision of an asset.
get.description: Returns the highest-tagged revision of the requested asset.

parameters.name: assetKey
parameters.description: The asset's key.

parameters.name: embed
parameters.description: Embedded resources to return with the Asset Revision

get.summary: Gets the latest revision of an asset.
get.description: Returns the latest revision of the requested asset.

parameters.name: assetKey
parameters.description: The asset's key.

parameters.name: embed
parameters.description: Embedded resources to return with the Asset Revision

get.summary: Gets a specific revision of an asset.

parameters.name: assetKey
parameters.description: The asset's key.

parameters.name: revisionNumber
parameters.description: The revision number.

parameters.name: embed
parameters.description: Embedded resources to return with the Asset Revision

patch.summary: Sets the version tag and/or labels for an existing revision.
patch.description:
Setting the tag to null clears the existing revision tag.

API Client needs the **Asset management > Change** or **Release management > Release** permission.

parameters.name: assetKey
parameters.description: The asset's key.

parameters.name: revisionNumber
parameters.description: The revision number.

requestBody.description: The version tag and labels to apply to the revision.

patch.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **Asset management > Change** or **Release management > Release** permission.

get.summary: Gets the icon for a specific asset revision.
get.description: Returns the icon for the specific asset revision

parameters.name: assetKey
parameters.description: The asset's key.

parameters.name: revisionNumber
parameters.description: The revision number.

get.summary: Gets the metadata for a specific asset revision.
get.description: Returns the metadata for the specific asset revision

parameters.name: assetKey
parameters.description: The asset's key.

parameters.name: revisionNumber
parameters.description: The revision number.

get.summary: Gets the release notes for a specific asset revision.
get.description: Returns the release notes for the specific asset revision

parameters.name: assetKey
parameters.description: The asset's key.

parameters.name: revisionNumber
parameters.description: The revision number.

get.summary: Gets the signature for a specific asset revision.
get.description: Returns the signature for the specific asset revision

parameters.name: assetKey
parameters.description: The asset's key.

parameters.name: revisionNumber
parameters.description: The revision number.

get.summary: Gets the source code for a specific asset revision.
get.description:
Returns the source code for a specific asset revision

API Client needs the **Asset management > Open** permissions.

parameters.name: assetKey
parameters.description: The asset's key.

parameters.name: revisionNumber
parameters.description: The revision number.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **Asset management > Open** permissions.

get.summary: Lists all revisions of an asset.
get.description: Returns a paginated list of all revisions for a specific asset.

parameters.name: assetKey
parameters.description: The asset's key.

parameters.name: modelDigest
parameters.description: Match revisions with a specific model digest

parameters.name: revisionDateTimeSince
parameters.description: Match revisions created since a specific date

parameters.name: revisionDateTimeTo
parameters.description: Match revisions created until a specific date

parameters.name: isTagged
parameters.description: Filters revisions based on whether they have a tag.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Matches revisions with the specific tag

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Used for sorting the list. Ascending by default. Prepend a hyphen, "-", to get a descending sort. Allowed: revision, tag.

parameters.name: embed
parameters.description: Embedded resources to return with the Asset Revision

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results returned

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the first result returned

post.summary: Lists all assets versions according to the combined key/digest/revision filter.
post.description: Returns a list of asset revisions that match the specified filters.

requestBody.description: A list of filters to apply to the search.

post.summary: Creates a new upload operation for uploading files.
post.description:
Generates a pre-signed URL that you can use to upload a file.

This URL can then be used in other endpoints that require a file upload, such as creating a new asset revision.

revisionUserKey.description: Key of the user that created the revision (format: guid).

revisionUserName.description: Name of the user that created the revision.

revisionUserEmail.description: Email of the user that created the revision.

revisionDateTime.description: Timestamp when the revision was created.

tag.description: Version tag associated with this revision, in MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH format.

isExternal.description: If an application is installed by an external system

isDeployable.description: Indicates whether the application is of a deployable application type.

isBuiltInApp.description: Indicates whether the application is a built-in app.

fromTemplateKey.description: Key of the template used to generate the application (format: guid).

primaryColor.description: Primary color of the application (format: hexadecimal RGB with leading #).

urlPath.description: URL base path where the application will be made available. Only available for deployable applications.

templateType.description: Type of template when application is a template.

toolVersion.description: IDE version used to create the application revision.

sourceCodeBinaryUrl.description: URL to fetch the application source code.

metamodelJsonUrl.description: URL to fetch metamodel JSON, which contains meta-information about the application.

signatureBinaryUrl.description: URL to fetch the signature binary, to perform dependency analysis.

releaseNotesUrl.description: URL to fetch the release notes.

signatureDigest.description: Digest that allows checking if the the signature of any of the public elements of the application has changes. (format: guid)

compatibilitySignatureDigest.description: Digest that allows checking if the signature of any of the public elements of the application might have breaking changes. (format: guid)

modelDigest.description: Digest that allows checking if the application model has any changes. (format: guid)

labels.description: Dictionary of all the labels assigned to an application revision

runtime.description: If the application is of the 'External Library' type, this field will inform us in which runtime the high-code was written to run

publishUserEmail.description: Application Revision Last Publish User Email

publishUserKey.description: Application Revision Last Publish User Key

ApplicationVersion.description: Represents a version of an application.

type.description: Descriptive value for the asset type.

signatureDigest.description: Digest that allows checking if the the signature of any of the public elements of the application has changes.

compatibilitySignatureDigest.description: Digest that allows checking if the signature of any of the public elements of the application might have breaking changes.

modelDigest.description: Digest that allows checking if the application model has any changes.

producers.description: All child producers this producer depends on.

iconUrl.description: URL to fetch the application icon, if one is defined

assetVersionFilters.description: Filters which asset versions to retrieve

embeds.description: Extra embedded fields to include in the output

templateType.description: Type of template when asset is a template.

toolVersion.description: IDE version used to create the asset revision.

runtime.description: If the asset is of the 'External Library' type, this field will inform us in which runtime the high-code was written to run

assemblyVersion.description: If the asset is of the 'Model Plugin' type, this field will inform us in which is the assembly version of the internal image

assemblyName.description: If the asset is of the 'Model Plugin' type, this field will inform us in which is the assembly name of the internal image

urlPath.description: URL base path where the asset will be made available. Only available for deployable asset.

isDeployable.description: Indicates whether the asset is of a deployable asset type.

isBuiltInAsset.description: Indicates whether the asset is a built-in app.

commitMessage.description: An optional commit message that can be populated by the user when creating or updating an asset version.

tag.description: The version tag that is associated with the revision, using the semantic versioning format (MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH).

releaseNoteUrl.description: URL to fetch the asset release note

tag.description: The version tag that is associated with the revision, using the semantic versioning format (MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH).

content.description: The release notes text content associated with the revision.

isExternal.description: If an asset is installed by an external system

tag.description: Version tag associated with this revision, in MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH format.

modelDigest.description: Digest that allows checking if the asset model has any changes. (format: guid)

clonedFromTemplateKey.description: Key of the template used to generate the asset (format: guid).

createdBy.description: Identifier of whom or what tool created the revision

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the revision was created.

commitMessage.description: An optional commit message that can be populated by the user when creating or updating an asset version.

taggedBy.description: Identifier of whom or what tool tagged the revision

AssetRevisionV1ListResponse.description: Represents a response containing a list of results.

AssetRevisionV1PagedListResponse.description: Represents a response containing a paged set of results.

signatureBinaryUrl.description: URL to fetch the signature binary, to perform dependency analysis

signatureDigest.description: Digest that allows checking if the the signature of any of the public elements of the application has changes.

compatibilitySignatureDigest.description: Digest that allows checking if the signature of any of the public elements of the application might have breaking changes.

sourceCodeBinaryUrl.description: URL to fetch the application source code

tag.description:
SemVer tag to associate with the revision to be created.

Must not exist and be of the Major#.Minor#.Patch# format

releaseNotes.description: The release notes associated with the asset. Cant be present if no tag is provided.

skipSequentialVersionValidation.description: If set to true, skips the sequential revision validation.

commitMessage.description: An optional commit message that can be populated when creating or updating an asset version.

fileUri.description:
(Optional) Allows providing application source code for the new version (OML or XIF formats are supported). 

If an OML or XIF is provided, its key is used to associate to the correct application - The application key must always match the OML/XIF key

key.description:
Key of the application to filter by

Mandatory

digest.description:
Digest of the application to filter by, if empty will be ignored

Either digest, revision or IsHighestTag are mandatory

revision.description:
Revision of the application to filter by, if null it will be ignored

Either digest, revision or IsHighestTag are mandatory

isHighestTag.description:
Flag to filter application for the highest tag, if false it will be ignored

Either digest, revision or IsHighestTag are mandatory

tag.description:
SemVer tag to associate with the revision

Must exist and be of the Major#.Minor#.Patch# format

releaseNotes.description: The release notes associated with the asset. Cant be present if no tag is set or provided.

commitMessage.description: Commit message to associate with the revision, optional and can be null.

templateType.description: Type of template when asset is a template.

toolVersion.description: IDE version used to create the asset revision.

runtime.description: If the asset is of the 'External Library' type, this field will inform us in which runtime the high-code was written to run

assemblyVersion.description: If the asset is of the 'Model Plugin' type, this field will inform us in which is the assembly version of the internal image

assemblyName.description: If the asset is of the 'Model Plugin' type, this field will inform us in which is the assembly name of the internal image

urlPath.description: URL base path where the asset will be made available. Only available for deployable asset.

isDeployable.description: Indicates whether the asset is of a deployable asset type.

isBuiltInAsset.description: Indicates whether the asset is a built-in app.

count.description: Number of results in the current page.

offset.description: Offset of the current page of results.

nextPageOffset.description: Offset of the next page of results.

PageInfoWithTotals.description: Contains response page information including totals.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem.

status.description: The HTTP status code applicable to the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation of the error.

instance.description: A URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.

traceId.description: This field helps OutSystems support track and investigate specific error occurrences. Providing this identifier when reporting an issue allows for more precise and faster troubleshooting.

errorCode.description: This error code serves the purpose to communicate with OutSystems Support and help diagnose errors.

ProblemDetails.description: A standardized error response as per RFC 7807 (Problem Details for HTTP APIs).

uploadUrl.description: URL to where the file needs to be uploaded

bearerAuth.description: Enter your bearer token in the format 'Bearer {token}'
